dosage.children: Same as adults, dose by weight.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

bacitracin.definition: A topical polypeptide antibiotic for skin and eye infections.

dosage.adults: Apply to affected area 1-3 times daily.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

cefadroxil.definition: A first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic for skin, urinary, and respiratory infections.
cefadroxil.mechanism: Inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis by binding to penicillin-binding proteins.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

cefazolin.definition: A first-generation cephalosporin antibiotic for surgical prophylaxis and various infections.
cefazolin.mechanism: Inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis by binding to penicillin-binding proteins.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

benzalkonium chloride.definition: A quaternary ammonium compound used as a topical antiseptic and preservative.

pramoxine.definition: A topical local anesthetic for minor skin irritation and hemorrhoids.

sincalide.definition: A synthetic cholecystokinin (CCK) analog used as a diagnostic agent.

rifampin.definition: A rifamycin antibiotic for tuberculosis and other bacterial infections.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

rizatriptan.mechanism: Vasoconstricts cranial blood vessels and inhibits neuropeptide release.

naratriptan.mechanism: Vasoconstricts cranial blood vessels and inhibits neuropeptide release.

almotriptan.mechanism: Vasoconstricts cranial blood vessels and inhibits neuropeptide release.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

zolmitriptan.definition: A selective serotonin (5-HT1B/1D) agonist for acute migraine.
zolmitriptan.mechanism: Vasoconstricts cranial blood vessels and inhibits neuropeptide release.

eletriptan.mechanism: Vasoconstricts cranial blood vessels and inhibits neuropeptide release.

solifenacin.mechanism: Blocks muscarinic receptors in the bladder.

Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

micafungin.definition: An echinocandin antifungal for candidemia and esophageal candidiasis.
micafungin.mechanism: Inhibits beta-(1,3)-D-glucan synthesis in fungal cell walls.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

flucytosine.definition: An antimetabolite antifungal for cryptococcal meningitis and severe candidiasis (with amphotericin B).
flucytosine.mechanism: Inhibits fungal DNA and RNA synthesis.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

nystatin.definition: A polyene antifungal for oral, cutaneous, and vaginal candidiasis.
nystatin.mechanism: Binds ergosterol, forming pores in fungal cell membranes.

dosage.adults: Oral: 400,000-600,000 units 4 times daily; Topical: apply 2-3 times daily.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

gentian violet.definition: A topical antiseptic and antifungal for skin and mucosal infections.
gentian violet.mechanism: Disrupts microbial cell walls and inhibits growth.

dosage.adults: Apply to affected area 1-2 times daily.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

terconazole.definition: An imidazole antifungal for vulvovaginal candidiasis.
terconazole.mechanism: Inhibits ergosterol synthesis in fungal cell membranes.

dosage.adults: Suppository: 80 mg vaginally once daily for 3 days; Cream: 0.4-0.8% once daily for 3-7 days.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

tioconazole.definition: An imidazole antifungal for vaginal yeast infections.
tioconazole.mechanism: Inhibits ergosterol synthesis in fungal cell membranes.

dosage.adults: 300 mg ointment intravaginally as a single dose.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

boric acid.definition: A topical antiseptic and antifungal for vaginal yeast infections and minor wounds.
boric acid.mechanism: Disrupts microbial cell walls and inhibits growth.

dosage.adults: 600 mg vaginal suppository once daily for 7-14 days.

special populations.pregnancy: Contraindicated.

tazarotene.definition: A topical retinoid for psoriasis and acne.
tazarotene.mechanism: Modulates gene expression, reducing keratinocyte proliferation.

dosage.adults: Apply thin layer to affected area once daily.

special populations.pregnancy: Contraindicated.

abobotulinumtoxinA.definition: A botulinum toxin type A for muscle spasticity, cervical dystonia, and cosmetic use.
abobotulinumtoxinA.mechanism: Blocks acetylcholine release at neuromuscular junction.

dosage.adults: Dose varies by indication and site.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

azficel-t.definition: An autologous fibroblast cellular therapy for nasolabial fold wrinkles.
azficel-t.mechanism: Injects cultured fibroblasts to improve skin structure.

uridine.definition: A pyrimidine nucleoside for hereditary orotic aciduria and as an antidote for fluorouracil toxicity.
uridine.mechanism: Replenishes pyrimidine pools and counteracts fluorouracil toxicity.

dosage.adults: 10 g orally every 6 hours for 20 doses (fluorouracil toxicity).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

rilonacept.definition: An interleukin-1 inhibitor for cryopyrin-associated periodic syndromes (CAPS) and recurrent pericarditis.
rilonacept.mechanism: Binds IL-1, preventing its inflammatory effects.

dosage.adults: 320 mg SC loading, then 160 mg weekly.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

canakinumab.definition: An interleukin-1 beta inhibitor for autoinflammatory diseases.
canakinumab.mechanism: Binds IL-1β, preventing its inflammatory effects.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

telotristat.definition: A tryptophan hydroxylase inhibitor for carcinoid syndrome diarrhea.
telotristat.mechanism: Reduces serotonin production in neuroendocrine tumors.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

perflutren.definition: An ultrasound contrast agent for echocardiography.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

dexrazoxane.definition: A cardioprotective agent for doxorubicin-induced cardiotoxicity and anthracycline extravasation.
dexrazoxane.mechanism: Chelates iron, reducing free radical formation.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

simvastatin.definition: A statin for hypercholesterolemia and cardiovascular risk reduction.
simvastatin.mechanism: Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol synthesis.

special populations.pregnancy: Contraindicated.

ramipril.definition: An ACE inhibitor for hypertension, heart failure, and cardiovascular risk reduction.
ramipril.mechanism: Inhibits ACE, decreasing angiotensin II production.

special populations.pregnancy: Contraindicated.

telmisartan.definition: An angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) for hypertension and cardiovascular risk reduction.

special populations.pregnancy: Contraindicated.

empagliflozin.definition: A sodium-glucose co-transporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibitor for type 2 diabetes and heart failure.
empagliflozin.mechanism: Inhibits SGLT2 in the kidney, increasing urinary glucose excretion.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

liraglutide.definition: A GLP-1 receptor agonist for type 2 diabetes and obesity.
liraglutide.mechanism: Increases insulin secretion, decreases glucagon, slows gastric emptying.

dosage.adults: 0.6-1.8 mg SC once daily (diabetes); up to 3 mg (obesity).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

alirocumab.mechanism: Inhibits PCSK9, increasing LDL receptor availability.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

evolocumab.mechanism: Inhibits PCSK9, increasing LDL receptor availability.

dosage.adults: 140 mg SC every 2 weeks or 420 mg monthly.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

canagliflozin.definition: A sodium-glucose co-transporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibitor for type 2 diabetes.
canagliflozin.mechanism: Inhibits SGLT2 in the kidney, increasing urinary glucose excretion.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

metformin.definition: A biguanide oral hypoglycemic for type 2 diabetes.
metformin.mechanism: Decreases hepatic glucose production and increases insulin sensitivity.

dosage.adults: 500-2000 mg orally daily in divided doses.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

icosapent.definition: A purified eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) for hypertriglyceridemia and cardiovascular risk reduction.

dosage.adults: 2 g orally twice daily with food.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

semaglutide.definition: A GLP-1 receptor agonist for type 2 diabetes and obesity.
semaglutide.mechanism: Increases insulin secretion, decreases glucagon, slows gastric emptying.

dosage.adults: 0.25-2 mg SC once weekly (diabetes); up to 2.4 mg (obesity).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

levocarnitine.definition: A nutritional supplement for carnitine deficiency.
levocarnitine.mechanism: Facilitates transport of fatty acids into mitochondria for energy production.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

siltuximab.definition: An anti-IL-6 monoclonal antibody for multicentric Castleman disease.

sodium oxybate.definition: A CNS depressant for cataplexy and excessive daytime sleepiness in narcolepsy.
sodium oxybate.mechanism: Acts as a GABA-B agonist and CNS depressant.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

milnacipran.definition: A serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) for fibromyalgia.
milnacipran.mechanism: Inhibits reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

doxepin.definition: A tricyclic antidepressant for depression, anxiety, and insomnia.
doxepin.mechanism: Inhibits reuptake of norepinephrine and serotonin.

dosage.adults: 75-300 mg orally daily (depression); 3-6 mg at bedtime (insomnia).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

desmopressin.definition: A synthetic vasopressin analog for diabetes insipidus, hemophilia A, and nocturnal enuresis.
desmopressin.mechanism: Increases water reabsorption in kidneys; increases factor VIII and vWF release.

iopromide.mechanism: Enhances X-ray contrast by increasing absorption in blood vessels/tissues.

mannitol.definition: An osmotic diuretic for increased intracranial/intraocular pressure and acute renal failure.

trihexyphenidyl.definition: An anticholinergic for Parkinson's disease and drug-induced extrapyramidal symptoms.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

ticlopidine.definition: An oral antiplatelet agent for stroke prevention (rarely used due to toxicity).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

nimodipine.definition: A dihydropyridine calcium channel blocker for subarachnoid hemorrhage.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

carbamide peroxide.definition: A topical agent for earwax removal and oral hygiene.
carbamide peroxide.mechanism: Releases oxygen, softening and loosening earwax/debris.

rimabotulinumtoxinB.definition: A botulinum toxin type B for cervical dystonia and sialorrhea.
rimabotulinumtoxinB.mechanism: Blocks acetylcholine release at neuromuscular junction.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

indications: Local, regional, epidural, and nerve block anesthesia

ropivacaine.definition: An amide-type local anesthetic for regional, epidural, and nerve block anesthesia.
ropivacaine.mechanism: Blocks sodium channels, inhibiting nerve impulse conduction.
indications: Local, regional, epidural, and nerve block anesthesia

dosage.adults: Max 200-250 mg per dose (varies by block).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

cefotetan.definition: A second-generation cephalosporin antibiotic for surgical prophylaxis and infections.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

tizanidine.definition: A centrally acting alpha-2 agonist muscle relaxant for spasticity.

carisoprodol.mechanism: Interrupts neuronal communication in the reticular formation and spinal cord.

dosage.adults: 250-350 mg orally 3 times daily and at bedtime.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

metaxalone.definition: A centrally acting muscle relaxant for musculoskeletal pain.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

chlorzoxazone.definition: A centrally acting muscle relaxant for musculoskeletal pain.
chlorzoxazone.mechanism: Acts at the spinal cord and subcortical brain levels to inhibit polysynaptic reflexes.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

orphenadrine.definition: A centrally acting muscle relaxant and anticholinergic for musculoskeletal pain.
orphenadrine.mechanism: Anticholinergic and analgesic effects; CNS depression.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

dosage.children: Use with caution; avoid in <12 years.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

amifostine.definition: A cytoprotective agent to reduce toxicity of chemotherapy and radiation.
amifostine.mechanism: Free radical scavenger; protects normal tissues.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

hydralazine.definition: A direct-acting vasodilator for hypertension and heart failure.

acyclovir.definition: An antiviral for herpes simplex, varicella-zoster, and herpes zoster infections.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

valacyclovir.definition: A prodrug of acyclovir for herpes simplex and varicella-zoster infections.
valacyclovir.mechanism: Converted to acyclovir; inhibits viral DNA polymerase.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

immune globulin intramuscular.mechanism: Provides passive immunity via pooled antibodies.

dosage.children: Same as adults, dose by weight.

contraindications: IgA deficiency with antibodies to IgA

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

foscarnet.definition: A pyrophosphate analog antiviral for CMV and acyclovir-resistant HSV infections.
foscarnet.mechanism: Inhibits viral DNA polymerase and reverse transcriptase.

dosage.adults: 60 mg/kg IV every 8 hours or 90 mg/kg every 12 hours.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

cholera vaccine, live.mechanism: Induces immunity to Vibrio cholerae O1.
indications: Prevention of cholera (travelers to endemic areas)

special populations.pregnancy: Avoid if possible.

pravastatin.definition: A statin for hypercholesterolemia and cardiovascular risk reduction.
pravastatin.mechanism: Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol synthesis.

lovastatin.definition: A statin for hypercholesterolemia and cardiovascular risk reduction.
lovastatin.mechanism: Inhibits HMG-CoA reductase, reducing cholesterol synthesis.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

niacin.definition: A B vitamin (B3) used to treat dyslipidemia.
niacin.mechanism: Inhibits hepatic VLDL synthesis, lowering LDL and TG, raising HDL.

dosage.adults: 500-2000 mg orally daily in divided doses.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

fenofibric acid.definition: A fibric acid derivative for hypertriglyceridemia.
fenofibric acid.mechanism: Activates PPAR-alpha, increasing lipolysis of triglycerides.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

coagulation factor ix.definition: A clotting factor for hemophilia B.

dosage.children: Same as adults, dose by weight.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

dextromethorphan.mechanism: Suppresses cough center in the medulla.

dosage.adults: 10-20 mg orally every 4 hours as needed.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

homatropine.definition: An anticholinergic used as a mydriatic/cycloplegic and antitussive (in combination).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

entecavir.definition: A nucleoside analog antiviral for chronic hepatitis B.

tenofovir alafenamide.definition: A nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitor for hepatitis B and HIV.

sofosbuvir.definition: A nucleotide analog NS5B polymerase inhibitor for hepatitis C.

velpatasvir.definition: A direct-acting antiviral for hepatitis C (with sofosbuvir).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

elbasvir.definition: A direct-acting antiviral for hepatitis C (with grazoprevir).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

grazoprevir.definition: A protease inhibitor for hepatitis C (with elbasvir).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

glecaprevir.definition: A protease inhibitor for hepatitis C (with pibrentasvir).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

plecanatide.definition: A guanylate cyclase-C agonist for chronic idiopathic constipation and IBS-C.

prucalopride.definition: A selective 5-HT4 agonist for chronic idiopathic constipation.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

interferon beta-1b.definition: A recombinant interferon for relapsing forms of multiple sclerosis.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

immune globulin subcutaneous.definition: A preparation of pooled human immunoglobulin G (IgG) for immune deficiencies.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

levothyroxine.definition: A synthetic thyroid hormone for hypothyroidism.

midodrine.definition: An alpha-1 agonist for symptomatic orthostatic hypotension.

oxycodone.definition: A semi-synthetic opioid analgesic for moderate to severe pain.

dupilumab.definition: A monoclonal antibody for atopic dermatitis, asthma, and chronic rhinosinusitis with nasal polyposis.

ergotamine.mechanism: Vasoconstricts cranial blood vessels via serotonin receptors.

dosage.adults: 5 mg/kg IV every 12 hours (induction); 5 mg/kg IV daily (maintenance).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

valganciclovir.mechanism: Converted to ganciclovir; inhibits viral DNA polymerase.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

dexmedetomidine.mechanism: Activates central alpha-2 receptors, producing sedation and analgesia.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

dobutamine.definition: A beta-1 agonist inotrope for acute heart failure and cardiogenic shock.
dobutamine.mechanism: Stimulates beta-1 receptors, increasing cardiac contractility.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

teduglutide.definition: A GLP-2 analog for short bowel syndrome.
teduglutide.mechanism: Enhances intestinal absorption by promoting mucosal growth.

dosage.children: Same as adults, dose by weight.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

demeclocycline.definition: A tetracycline antibiotic with off-label use for SIADH.
demeclocycline.mechanism: Inhibits protein synthesis; reduces renal response to ADH.

dosage.adults: 600-1200 mg orally daily in divided doses.

special populations.pregnancy: Contraindicated.

cevimeline.definition: A muscarinic agonist for dry mouth in Sjögren's syndrome.
cevimeline.mechanism: Stimulates muscarinic receptors, increasing exocrine secretion.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

tecovirimat.definition: An antiviral for treatment of smallpox and orthopoxvirus infections.
tecovirimat.mechanism: Inhibits viral envelope protein, preventing viral spread.

dosage.adults: 600 mg orally twice daily for 14 days.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

smallpox vaccine.definition: A live vaccinia virus vaccine for prevention of smallpox.
smallpox vaccine.mechanism: Induces active immunity against smallpox virus.

special populations.pregnancy: Contraindicated.

nicotine.definition: A cholinergic agonist for smoking cessation (patch, gum, lozenge, etc.).

dosage.adults: Patch: 7-21 mg/day; Gum/lozenge: 2-4 mg as needed.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

varenicline.definition: A partial nicotinic receptor agonist for smoking cessation.
varenicline.mechanism: Partially stimulates and blocks nicotine receptors.

dosage.adults: 0.5 mg orally daily for 3 days, then 0.5 mg twice daily for 4 days, then 1 mg twice daily.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

papaverine.definition: A vasodilator for vasospasm and erectile dysfunction (off-label).
papaverine.mechanism: Inhibits phosphodiesterase, increasing cAMP and cGMP.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

larotrectinib.definition: A TRK inhibitor for solid tumors with NTRK gene fusion.
indications: Solid tumors with NTRK gene fusion

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

entrectinib.definition: A TRK, ROS1, and ALK inhibitor for NTRK fusion-positive solid tumors and ROS1-positive NSCLC.
entrectinib.mechanism: Inhibits TRK, ROS1, and ALK fusion proteins.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

dyclonine.definition: A topical local anesthetic for oral and throat pain.
dyclonine.mechanism: Blocks sodium channels, inhibiting nerve conduction.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

butamben.definition: A topical local anesthetic for skin and mucous membrane pain.
butamben.mechanism: Blocks sodium channels, inhibiting nerve conduction.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

nusinersen.definition: An antisense oligonucleotide for spinal muscular atrophy (SMA).
nusinersen.mechanism: Modifies SMN2 splicing, increasing SMN protein production.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

onasemnogene abeparvovec.definition: A gene therapy for spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) in children <2 years.
onasemnogene abeparvovec.mechanism: Delivers functional SMN1 gene via AAV9 vector.

dosage.children: 1.1 x 10^14 vector genomes/kg IV single dose.

special populations.pregnancy: Not indicated.

golimumab.definition: An anti-TNF-alpha monoclonal antibody for autoimmune diseases.

dosage.adults: 50 mg SC monthly (RA, PsA, AS); 200 mg SC at week 0, 100 mg at week 2, then 100 mg every 4 weeks (UC).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

pentobarbital.definition: A barbiturate sedative-hypnotic for sedation, anesthesia, and status epilepticus.

dosage.adults: 100-200 mg IM/IV; 1-3 mg/kg IV for status epilepticus.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

fosphenytoin.definition: A water-soluble prodrug of phenytoin for status epilepticus and seizures.

dosage.children: Same as adults, dose by weight.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

sacrosidase.definition: An oral enzyme for congenital sucrase-isomaltase deficiency.
sacrosidase.mechanism: Replaces sucrase enzyme, aiding sucrose digestion.

special populations.pregnancy: Not indicated.

valbenazine.definition: A VMAT2 inhibitor for tardive dyskinesia.
valbenazine.mechanism: Reduces dopamine release by inhibiting VMAT2.

dosage.adults: 40 mg orally once daily, may increase to 80 mg.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

apomorphine.definition: A dopamine agonist for acute, intermittent treatment of 'off' episodes in Parkinson's disease.
apomorphine.mechanism: Stimulates dopamine receptors in the brain.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

tetanus immune globulin.definition: A human immune globulin for passive immunization against tetanus.
tetanus immune globulin.mechanism: Provides antibodies to neutralize tetanus toxin.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

avatrombopag.definition: A thrombopoietin receptor agonist for thrombocytopenia in chronic liver disease and ITP.

dosage.adults: 40-60 mg orally daily for 5 days (liver disease); 20 mg daily (ITP).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

lusutrombopag.definition: A thrombopoietin receptor agonist for thrombocytopenia in chronic liver disease.

dosage.adults: 3 mg orally once daily for up to 7 days.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

caplacizumab.definition: A nanobody for acquired thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura (aTTP).

dosage.adults: 10 mg IV bolus, then 10 mg SC daily.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

teprotumumab.definition: An IGF-1R inhibitor for thyroid eye disease (Graves' orbitopathy).
teprotumumab.mechanism: Blocks IGF-1 receptor, reducing inflammation and tissue expansion.

dosage.adults: 10 mg/kg IV first infusion, then 20 mg/kg IV every 3 weeks (8 infusions).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.
Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

povidone iodine.definition: A topical antiseptic for skin, mucous membranes, and wound care.
povidone iodine.mechanism: Releases iodine, disrupting microbial proteins and DNA.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

isopropyl alcohol.mechanism: Denatures proteins and disrupts cell membranes.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

sodium hypochlorite.definition: A topical antiseptic and disinfectant for wound care and root canal irrigation.
sodium hypochlorite.mechanism: Releases chlorine, disrupting microbial proteins and DNA.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

pimozide.definition: A typical antipsychotic for Tourette's disorder and resistant schizophrenia.
pimozide.mechanism: Blocks dopamine D2 receptors in the CNS.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

dosage.children: Same as adults, dose by weight.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

rifapentine.definition: A rifamycin antibiotic for tuberculosis (with other drugs).
rifapentine.mechanism: Inhibits DNA-dependent RNA polymerase in mycobacteria.

dosage.adults: 600 mg orally once or twice weekly.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

bcg.definition: A live attenuated Mycobacterium bovis vaccine for tuberculosis and bladder cancer immunotherapy.
bcg.mechanism: Induces immune response against mycobacteria and tumor cells.

dosage.adults: Vaccine: 0.1 mL ID; Bladder: 50 mg in 50 mL saline intravesical.

special populations.pregnancy: Contraindicated.

bcg vaccine.definition: A live attenuated Mycobacterium bovis vaccine for tuberculosis prevention.

special populations.pregnancy: Contraindicated.

bedaquiline.definition: A diarylquinoline antitubercular for multidrug-resistant TB.

dosage.adults: 400 mg orally daily for 2 weeks, then 200 mg three times weekly.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

aminosalicylic acid.mechanism: Inhibits folic acid synthesis in mycobacteria.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

pretomanid.definition: A nitroimidazooxazine antitubercular for extensively drug-resistant TB.
indications: Extensively drug-resistant tuberculosis (with bedaquiline and linezolid)

dosage.adults: 200 mg orally once daily for 26 weeks.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

typhoid vaccine, live.definition: A live oral vaccine for prevention of typhoid fever.
typhoid vaccine, live.mechanism: Induces active immunity against Salmonella typhi.
indications: Prevention of typhoid fever (travelers, endemic areas)

dosage.adults: 1 capsule orally every other day for 4 doses.

special populations.pregnancy: Contraindicated.

typhoid vaccine, inactivated.definition: An inactivated injectable vaccine for prevention of typhoid fever.
typhoid vaccine, inactivated.mechanism: Induces active immunity against Salmonella typhi.
indications: Prevention of typhoid fever (travelers, endemic areas)
contraindications: Severe allergic reaction to vaccine components

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

olsalazine.definition: A prodrug of mesalamine for ulcerative colitis.
olsalazine.mechanism: Converted to mesalamine in the colon, reducing inflammation.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

sodium phenylbutyrate.definition: A nitrogen-binding agent for urea cycle disorders.
sodium phenylbutyrate.mechanism: Conjugates with glutamine, promoting excretion of nitrogen.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

glycerol phenylbutyrate.definition: A nitrogen-binding agent for urea cycle disorders.
glycerol phenylbutyrate.mechanism: Conjugates with glutamine, promoting excretion of nitrogen.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

potassium acid phosphate.definition: A phosphate and potassium supplement for deficiency states.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

valrubicin.definition: An anthracycline antineoplastic for bladder cancer (intravesical).
indications: BCG-refractory carcinoma in situ of the bladder

dosage.adults: 800 mg in 75 mL saline intravesical once weekly for 6 weeks.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

durvalumab.definition: A PD-L1 inhibitor for urothelial carcinoma and NSCLC.
durvalumab.mechanism: Blocks PD-L1, enhancing T-cell immune response.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

enfortumab vedotin.definition: An antibody-drug conjugate for urothelial carcinoma.
enfortumab vedotin.mechanism: Targets Nectin-4 and delivers MMAE cytotoxin.
indications: Locally advanced or metastatic urothelial carcinoma

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

polidocanol.definition: A sclerosing agent for varicose veins and spider veins.

dosage.adults: 0.5-3% solution, dose per vein and procedure.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

sodium tetradecyl sulfate.definition: A sclerosing agent for varicose veins and spider veins.

dosage.adults: 0.1-3% solution, dose per vein and procedure.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

antivenin (crotalidae) polyvalent.definition: A polyvalent antivenom for North American pit viper (rattlesnake, copperhead, cottonmouth) bites.

dosage.adults: 10-20 vials IV initially, repeat as needed.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

antivenin (micrurus fulvius).definition: A specific antivenom for Eastern coral snake (Micrurus fulvius) bites.
antivenin (micrurus fulvius).mechanism: Binds and neutralizes coral snake venom.

dosage.adults: 3-5 vials IV initially, repeat as needed.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

antivenin (black widow spider).definition: A specific antivenom for black widow spider (Latrodectus) bites.
antivenin (black widow spider).mechanism: Binds and neutralizes black widow spider venom.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

betrixaban.definition: An oral factor Xa inhibitor anticoagulant for VTE prophylaxis in acute medical illness.
betrixaban.mechanism: Inhibits factor Xa, reducing thrombin generation.

dosage.adults: 160 mg orally once, then 80 mg daily for 35-42 days.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

dextran, low molecular weight.definition: A plasma expander for hypovolemia and as an anticoagulant adjunct.
dextran, low molecular weight.mechanism: Increases plasma oncotic pressure, inhibits platelet aggregation.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

vitamin a.definition: A fat-soluble vitamin for deficiency, eye health, and immune function.
vitamin a.mechanism: Essential for vision, immune function, and cell growth.

special populations.pregnancy: Avoid high doses.

beta-carotene.mechanism: Converted to vitamin A in the body.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

multivitamin with minerals.definition: A dietary supplement containing multiple vitamins and minerals.

special populations.pregnancy: Prenatal formulas preferred.

chromium picolinate.definition: A trace element supplement for chromium deficiency and glycemic control (unproven).

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

selenium.definition: A trace element supplement for deficiency and antioxidant support.

special populations.pregnancy: Generally considered safe.

multivitamin, prenatal.definition: A dietary supplement with vitamins and minerals for pregnancy.
multivitamin, prenatal.mechanism: Provides essential nutrients for fetal development.

special populations.pregnancy: Indicated.

ocriplasmin.definition: A recombinant protease for symptomatic vitreomacular adhesion.
ocriplasmin.mechanism: Breaks down proteins at vitreoretinal interface.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

desipramine.definition: A tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) primarily used for depression and sometimes for neuropathic pain.
desipramine.mechanism: Inhibits reuptake of norepinephrine and, to a lesser extent, serotonin in the CNS.

dosage.adults: 100–200 mg orally daily, up to 300 mg/day; start lower and titrate.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

trientine.definition: A copper chelating agent for Wilson's disease.
trientine.mechanism: Binds copper, increasing its urinary excretion.

dosage.adults: 750–1,500 mg orally daily in 2–4 divided doses on an empty stomach.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

burosumab.definition: A monoclonal antibody for X-linked hypophosphatemia (XLH) and tumor-induced osteomalacia.
burosumab.mechanism: Binds and inhibits FGF23, increasing renal phosphate reabsorption and vitamin D production.

special populations.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks.

interactions: Oral phosphate, active vitamin D analogs

yellow fever vaccine.definition: A live attenuated vaccine for prevention of yellow fever.
yellow fever vaccine.mechanism: Induces active immunity against yellow fever virus.
indications: Prevention of yellow fever (travelers to endemic areas, outbreak control)

dosage.adults: 0.5 mL SC single dose at least 10 days before exposure.

contraindications: Severe allergy to egg or vaccine components

special populations.pregnancy: Avoid unless risk of exposure outweighs risk.

interactions: Other live vaccines (space by 4 weeks if not given same day)
